DataElement.preferredDefinition: The type that indicates the Stem cell transplant type received.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Procedure Domain Type of Stem Cell Transplant
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to procedure.:Type of stem-cell transplantation the subject received.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to procedure.

Property.preferredDefinition: Type of stem-cell transplantation the subject received.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Tests, examinations, evaluations used to determine a subject's status or response to intervention.
ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: Created initially to support CCR value domain for CTMS.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A therapeutic procedure that involves the transplantation of hematopoietic stem cells, either with the patient as their own donor or from a donor to a patient. This can be used for treatment of malignant and non-malignant diseases._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The transference of stem cells within the same individual.

Concepts.definition: Stem cell transfer or transplantation in which the patient is their own donor.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Allogeneic Hematopoietic Stem Cell Transplantation Matched Related Donor To Patient
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A clinical treatment in which hematopoietic stem cells (HSCs) are transferred from one genetically dissimilar individual to another._A donor who is related to the transplant recipient, and who is a human leukocyte antigen (HLA) tissue type match._Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement._A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Concepts.definition: A clinical treatment in which hematopoietic stem cells (HSCs) are transferred from one genetically dissimilar individual to another.
A donor who is related to the transplant recipient, and who is a human leukocyte antigen (HLA) tissue type match.
Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.
A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Allogeneic Hematopoietic Stem Cell Transplantation Mismatched Related Donor To Patient
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A clinical treatment in which hematopoietic stem cells (HSCs) are transferred from one genetically dissimilar individual to another._A donor who is related to the recipient but is mismatched at at least 1 HLA locus._Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement._A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Concepts.definition: A clinical treatment in which hematopoietic stem cells (HSCs) are transferred from one genetically dissimilar individual to another.
A donor who is related to the recipient but is mismatched at at least 1 HLA locus.
Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.
A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Allogeneic Hematopoietic Stem Cell Transplantation Mismatched Unrelated Donor To Patient
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A clinical treatment in which hematopoietic stem cells (HSCs) are transferred from one genetically dissimilar individual to another._A donor who is not related to the transplant recipient, and who is not a human leukocyte antigen (HLA) tissue type match at one or more of the following loci: HLA-A, HLA-B, HLA-C, and HLA-DRB1._Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement._A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Concepts.definition: A clinical treatment in which hematopoietic stem cells (HSCs) are transferred from one genetically dissimilar individual to another.
A donor who is not related to the transplant recipient, and who is not a human leukocyte antigen (HLA) tissue type match at one or more of the following loci: HLA-A, HLA-B, HLA-C, and HLA-DRB1.
Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.
A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Allogeneic Hematopoietic Stem Cell Transplantation Umbilical Cord Blood Transplantation
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A clinical treatment in which hematopoietic stem cells (HSCs) are transferred from one genetically dissimilar individual to another._A therapeutic procedure that involves the transplantation of hematopoietic stem cells collected from the umbilical cord.

Concepts.definition: A clinical treatment in which hematopoietic stem cells (HSCs) are transferred from one genetically dissimilar individual to another.
A therapeutic procedure that involves the transplantation of hematopoietic stem cells collected from the umbilical cord.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A directive to indicate a response not listed.

Concepts.definition: A directive to indicate a response not listed.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Allogeneic Hematopoietic Stem Cell Transplantation Matched Unrelated Donor To Patient
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A clinical treatment in which hematopoietic stem cells (HSCs) are transferred from one genetically dissimilar individual to another._A donor who is not related to the transplant recipient, but who is a human leukocyte antigen (HLA) tissue type match._Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement._A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Concepts.definition: A clinical treatment in which hematopoietic stem cells (HSCs) are transferred from one genetically dissimilar individual to another.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Tests, examinations, evaluations used to determine a subject's status or response to intervention.
ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: Created initially to support CCR value domain for CTMS.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A method of replacing the immature blood-forming cells lost due to high-dose chemotherapy, and possibly radiation therapy, used to destroy leukemia cells.  The stem cells are given to the patient after treatment to help the bone marrow recover and continue producing healthy blood cells.:Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

Concepts.definition: A therapeutic procedure that involves the transplantation of hematopoietic stem cells, either with the patient as their own donor or from a donor to a patient. This can be used for treatment of malignant and non-malignant diseases.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ReferenceDocuments.description: What was the type of stem cell transplant received?
